column2: one day a stranger came to that town from over the hills and far away. With him he brought a painted picture
column3: but it was all covered with a curtain so that nobody could see what it was.He drew aside the curtain and showed the picture to the young king and it was a likeness of the most beautiful princess in the whole world; for her eyes were as black as a crow's wing
column4: her cheeks were as red as apples
column5: and her skin as white as snow. Moreover
column6: the picture was so natural that it seemed as though it had nothing to do but to open its lips and speak.The young king just sat and looked and looked. "Oh me!" said he
column7: "I will never rest content until I have such a one as that for my own.""Then listen!" said the stranger
column8: "this is a likeness of the princess that lives over beyond the three rivers. A while ago she had a wise bird on which she doted
column9: for it knew everything that happened in the world
column10: so that it could tell the princess whatever she wanted to know.
